Creation – God made the world on purpose

categories.title: Core Discipleship Practices
items: Bible Reading – Regularly engaging Scripture to know God's heart and truth
Prayer – Talking to God with honesty, dependence, and faith
Worship – Honoring God with your whole life, both privately and corporately
Confession and Repentance – Regularly turning from sin and realigning with God
Obedience to God's Word – Living out what you read and hear in Scripture
Fellowship with Believers – Committing to deep, accountable community
Gathering with the Church – Participating in weekly worship and sacraments
Baptism – Publicly identifying with Christ's death and resurrection
The Lord's Supper – Remembering and proclaiming Christ's sacrifice
Discipling Others – Helping others follow Jesus as you grow
Being Discipled – Placing yourself under the guidance of a mature believer
Evangelism – Sharing the gospel with those who don't know Christ
Serving Others – Using your time, talents, and gifts to meet needs
Generosity – Giving your money and resources joyfully and sacrificially
Sabbath and Rest – Trusting God by resting and worshiping regularly
Scripture Meditation and Memorization – Hiding God's Word in your heart
Spiritual Discernment – Testing ideas and choices by God's Word and Spirit
Submission to Spiritual Authority – Respecting and learning from leaders
Pursuit of Holiness – Actively putting off sin and pursuing righteousness
Perseverance in Trials – Trusting God through suffering and hardship

sections.title: Virtues of the Heart (Inner Disposition)
items: Humility – Thinking of others before yourself
Gratitude – A continual posture of thanksgiving
Peacefulness – An inner calm rooted in God's sovereignty
Contentment – Trusting God's provision and rejection of materialism and consumerism

sections.title: Virtues of Worship and Devotion (Toward God)
items: Faith – Trusting in God's character and promises
Hope – Confident expectation in God's future
Love for God – Wholehearted devotion and worship
Reverence (Fear of the Lord) – Holy awe and submission

sections.title: Relational Virtues (Toward Others)
items: Kindness – Choosing gentleness and compassion
Forgiveness – Letting go of offense
Patience – Bearing with others without irritation
Peacemaking – Actively seeking reconciliation
Service – Working sacrificially for the good of others
Honesty – Telling and living the truth

sections.title: Strength & Endurance Virtues (Persevering Under Trial)
items: Perseverance – Staying faithful under pressure and persecution
Courage – Standing firm in faith
Self-Control – Mastering desires and emotions
Diligence – Persistent and faithful work

sections.title: Virtues of Wisdom and Discernment (Right Thinking)
items: Discernment – Distinguishing truth from error
Teachability – Willingness to learn and grow
Wisdom – Living skillfully and righteously
Integrity – Wholeness of character

sections.title: Missional & Servant Virtues (Lived Action)
items: Generosity – Open-handed giving
Hospitality – Welcoming others
Justice – Standing for what is right
Compassion – Care for the poor and hurting
Evangelistic Boldness – Sharing Christ clearly and courageously

sections.title: Core Identity Traits
items: Christlikeness – Living a life modeled after the character of Jesus
Godliness – Living in a way that reflects reverence and devotion to God
Dependence on God – Trusting God's power, not your own
Holy Ambition – Pursuing God's glory above all else
Resilience – Recovering from hardship with spiritual strength

sections.title: Relational Character
items: Loyalty – Faithful commitment to people and promises
Empathy – Entering into others' joys and sorrows with them
Teachability – Willingness to be corrected and to grow
Accountability – Living openly before others with honesty
Graciousness – Responding to faults of others with undeserved kindness
Merciful – Cares for the needs of those who are hurting and in need
Compassionate – Hurts with those who hurt

Diligence – Faithfully and persistently doing your work well
Stewardship – Managing time, talent, and treasure for God's purposes

Courage – Staying faithful when leadership is costly

items: Perseverance – Remaining faithful through trials and delays
Consistency – Living out your faith with stability over time
Faithfulness – Keeping your word and showing up
Sobriety – Maintaining clarity, maturity, and seriousness about life

Holy – Love for what is holy and hatred for what is wicked
Submission – Desire to obey God
Reverent – There is a deep respect for all things about God

Meek – Restraint of ones strength
Zealous – Lives with passion and conviction
Contentment – Being satisfied in God regardless of circumstances
Joyfulness – Choosing delight in the Lord even amid sorrow
Sober – Thinking clearly and biblically in all things

categories.title: Top Discipleship Topics to Push Back on Secular Culture

sections.title: Cultural Discipleship
items: Biblical authority over personal – Trusting God's Word over personal feelings or cultural opinions
Sexual integrity in a culture of expression – Living according to God's design for sex, marriage, and purity
Identity in Christ vs. self-defined identity – Rooting our identity in who God says we are, not how we feel or what culture says
Holiness vs. cultural tolerance – Living set apart for God rather than blending into the world
Convictional kindness (truth and love together) – Holding to truth with a loving, gracious posture
Sacrificial community vs. consumer individualism – Committing to the church family, not just attending for personal benefit
Humility vs. self-promotion – Serving others instead of seeking to elevate ourselves
Generosity in a greedy culture – Using our money and possessions to bless others and honor God
The sacredness of life – Valuing all human life as made in God's image, from womb to grave
True justice vs. ideological activism – Pursuing justice God's way—not just following political or cultural trends
Forgiveness over bitterness – Letting go of offenses and extending grace to others
Sabbath and rest in a hustle culture – Trusting God enough to rest and honor rhythms of work and worship
Resilient faith under pressure – Following Jesus even when it's unpopular or costly
Biblical literacy vs. soundbite theology – Knowing the Bible deeply, not just quoting verses out of context
Spiritual discernment in a world of noise – Learning to recognize what is true and what is deceptive
Witness and evangelism in a hostile world – Boldly and wisely sharing the gospel with others
Discipleship as daily surrender, not just Sunday attendance – Following Jesus in every area of life, not just going to church
Biblical masculinity and femininity – Embracing God's good design for men and women
Hope and eternity vs. present comfort – Living for eternal reward, not just temporary ease
Prayer and dependence in a self-sufficient world – Relying on God daily instead of trusting in ourselves
Faithfulness in Suffering – Trusting God and remaining loyal to Him even in hardship, loss, or unanswered prayers
Obedience vs. Moral Relativism – Following God's commands even when the world says truth is flexible or optional
Spiritual Warfare Awareness – Recognizing we have a real enemy and learning to stand firm through prayer and truth
Self-Control in an Impulsive Age – Practicing discipline over desires, screens, habits, and appetites
Gratitude vs. Entitlement – Cultivating thankfulness instead of demanding what we think we deserve
Honoring God with Our Bodies – Living out worship through how we eat, rest, exercise, dress, and express ourselves physically
Stewarding Time in a Distracted World – Using time wisely for kingdom purposes instead of wasting it on endless entertainment
Honesty and Integrity – Speaking the truth, keeping promises, and living consistently in public and private
Living by the Spirit vs. Living by the Flesh – Letting the Holy Spirit guide decisions, emotions, and habits rather than sinful desires
Engaging Culture Without Compromise – Learning how to participate in society while maintaining gospel distinctiveness

sections.title: Critical Experiences for Spiritual Maturity
items: A Clear Encounter with the Gospel – A moment of clarity and conviction about Jesus' saving work—often marking true conversion or spiritual awakening
Repentance from a Personal Stronghold – A deep break from a sinful habit, idol, or false identity that leads to freedom and transformation
Answering God's Call to Risky Obedience – Following God in a situation that requires courage, sacrifice, or surrender—like forgiving someone deeply, changing careers, or moving in obedience
Profound Experience of God's Grace or Presence – A moment (or season) of deep spiritual intimacy—often during prayer, worship, or suffering—that changes how you see God
Walking Through Suffering or Loss with God – Trusting God through pain, grief, disappointment, or unfulfilled expectations—maturity deepens in the valley
Being Deeply Known in Christian Community – Letting others see your real life—sins, struggles, hopes—and receiving love, correction, and encouragement
Serving in a Way that Costs Something – Sacrificial ministry, leadership, or generosity that stretches your faith and breaks self-reliance
Sharing the Gospel and Seeing God Work – Witnessing the power of God in someone else's life through your obedience—boosting both faith and purpose
Receiving Correction or Discipline from Others – Humbly accepting truth from spiritual leaders or friends and growing as a result
Wrestling with Doubt and Finding God Faithful – A season of questions, theological tension, or disappointment—ending with deeper conviction and trust
Stepping into Leadership or Spiritual Responsibility – Being entrusted with influence or care for others, which drives dependence on Christ and intentional growth
Participating in a Cross-Cultural or Missional Context – Seeing God's work beyond your comfort zone—broadening your view of the gospel and the Church
Letting Go of Control – Releasing something you love (a dream, a relationship, a reputation) in surrender to God's will
Learning to Hear God's Voice – Distinguishing God's leading through Scripture, prayer, wise counsel, and the Spirit's nudging
Witnessing God's Faithfulness Over Time – Looking back over years and recognizing God's provision, sanctification, and sovereignty in your story

sections.title: Core Categories Of Sins
items: Sins of the heart
Sins of the tongue
Sins of omission
Sins against others
Sins against God

sections.title: Sins To Confront and Overcome
items: Pride – Self-exaltation, arrogance, or being unteachable
Greed – Loving money or possessions more than God or people
Lust – Craving sexual experiences outside God's design
Envy – Resenting what others have or rejoicing when they fail
Anger – Unrighteous outbursts, bitterness, or unforgiveness
Gluttony – Overindulgence or lack of self-control
Laziness – Avoiding responsibility, discipline, or diligence
Gossip – Spreading damaging or unnecessary information
Slander – Tearing others down, especially behind their back
Hypocrisy – Pretending to be more spiritual than you are
Dishonesty – Lying, deceiving, or misrepresenting the truth
Self-Righteousness – Thinking you're better than others spiritually
Idolatry – Loving anything more than God—success, family, image
Materialism – Finding security or identity in wealth and stuff
Fear of Man – Living to please people instead of God
Unforgiveness – Holding onto past offenses or bitterness
Sexual Immorality – All sexual activity outside of biblical marriage
Divisiveness – Causing strife in relationships or the church
Arrogance in Knowledge – Using theology to look smart, not love well
Neglect of the Poor – Ignoring the vulnerable and oppressed
Ingratitude – Complaining or failing to acknowledge God's goodness
Rebellion – Resisting spiritual authority or God's commands
Addictions – Being mastered by substances, screens, or habits
Covetousness – Always wanting more or what others have
Manipulation – Using people or controlling outcomes through deceit
Neglecting Prayer and the Word – Drifting from communion with God
Worldliness – Adopting the values, entertainment, or mindset of the world
Spiritual Apathy – Going through the motions without love or zeal
Judgmentalism – Condemning others without humility or compassion
Disobedience to the Spirit – Ignoring God's personal convictions or leadings
Complacency – Being spiritually stagnant, content without growth
Neglecting Fellowship – Isolating from the body of Christ
Withholding Generosity – Clinging to resources instead of giving freely
Neglecting Sabbath Rest – Constant busyness without honoring rest
Cynicism – Chronic skepticism that erodes faith and joy
Harboring Shame – Living in condemnation instead of God's grace
Impatience – Refusing to wait on God or others in love
Flattery – Manipulative praise to gain favor or influence
Disrespecting Parents – Dishonoring or ignoring God-given authority
Boasting – Drawing attention to yourself instead of glorifying God
